name: 8-hydroxyquinoline
Reason: The basic structure of quinoline has a melting point of around 23°C. The presence of the hydroxy (-OH) group introduces hydrogen bonding, which generally increases the melting point. Based on similar compounds, the hydroxy group is estimated to add around 50°C to the melting point of the core structure. Thus, the presence of the hydroxy group significantly increases the melting point of 8-hydroxyquinoline compared to quinoline.
